# Number of lines of code in checkStudentValue: 4
sub checkStudentValue {
  my $self = shift; my $student = shift;
  return $student->class ne 'Real';
}

public method Parser::Legacy::NumberWithUnits::makeValue (  ) 

Undocumented Method

Code:
click to view
# Number of lines of code in makeValue: 8
sub makeValue {
  my $self = shift; my $value = shift;
  my %options = (context => $self->context,@_);
  my $num = Value::makeValue($value,%options);
  Value::Error("A number with units must be a constant, not %s",lc(Value::showClass($num)))
    unless Value::isReal($num);
  return $num;
}

public method Parser::Legacy::NumberWithUnits::promote (  ) 

Undocumented Method

Code:
click to view
# Number of lines of code in promote: 7
sub promote {
  my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
  my $context = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? shift : $self->context);
  my $x = (scalar(@_) ? shift : $self);
  return $x->inContext($context) if (ref($x) eq $class || Value::isReal($x)) && scalar(@_) == 0;
  return $self->new($context,$x,@_);
}
public method Parser::Legacy::NumberWithUnits::string (  ) 

Undocumented Method

Code:
click to view
# Number of lines of code in string: 4
sub string {
  my $self = shift;
  Value::Real::string($self,@_) . ' ' . $self->{units};
}
public method Parser::Legacy::NumberWithUnits::TeX (  ) 

Undocumented Method

Code:

# Number of lines of code in TeX: 6
sub TeX {
  my $self = shift;
  my $n = Value::Real::string($self,@_);
  $n =~ s/E\+?(-?)0*([^)]*)/\\times 10^{$1$2}/i; # convert E notation to x10^(...)
  return $n . '\ ' . Parser::Legacy::ObjectWithUnits::TeXunits($self->{units});
}
